author: Myers

review: I like the fire TV box and stick both very much. they work very well and are priced very fairly but the stick I'm not so in love with. First of all why does it have to be a stick? if im going to have to plug a power cable into it what difference does it make if they made it a slightly different design that perhaps put it in a better position to disperse with the great deal of heat it produces. Of coarse everything works flawlessly as amazon is great at and if you need a cheap interface of this type to stream video and audio then you could do much worse and If you have prime then this is your only descent cheap option. compared to the box it is just as you would suspect. everything is less powerful and less swift in it's function. though it absolutely does what it's supposed to do and really rather well or at least well enough to get by if sixty dollars extra for the box will break you.I got one on lightning deal for another bedroom and it works great. despite a couple gripes about it's design and it's rapid production of heat I like it very much and find that it works splendidly. I highly recommend.

review: It worked for a few days, then repeatedly displayed NetWork Out of Range. After close to two hours on the line with Amazon and Verizon support representatives, decided to go for the only possible solution (which may not work at all) -- a router extender to bridge the 25 to 39 foot distance between the TV and the router. So why did it work for awhile? Service reps said network congestion; seems unlikely since it happened  on several different days in my undense neighborhood. My Verizon FIOs handles all of my other wireless devices quite well no matter where they are in the house. And the router extender costs more the Stick!So the network extender worked and i am able to use the fire stick.
